thread.title: Walsall's Rico Henry wins Football League Young Player of the Month
thread.title_full: Walsall's Rico Henry wins Football League Young Player of the Month

title: Walsall's Rico Henry wins Football League Young Player of the Month
text:
Tweet 
The 18-year-old, who has made 12 appearances in all competitions this season, has performed admirably at both left-back and left wing-back for Dean Smith's League One table-toppers. 
Henry burst onto the scene last December, making his first team debut in a Johnstone's Paint Trophy tie at Tranmere Rovers and has caught the eye since. 
Having not scored last season, the defender has already been on target twice in this campaign - including the only goal in last month's win at Scunthorpe. 
Henry said: "I feel very honoured to have won this award," 
"I joined the club at U12s and it’s been good, I just want to keep progressing. 
"The manager is good to work with. He has a lot of belief in me and plays me in difficult games but I deal with the pressure. 
“My targets are to score goals and do well here. I want to get to the Championship with Walsall.” 
Boss Smith was delighted when the attacking full-back put pen to paper on a new three-year deal at the Banks's stadium two weeks ago. 
The manager said: "Rico fully deserves it; he has been excellent," said Smith. 
"He’s a pleasure to coach and a pleasure to have around the place, not just as a footballer but as a person. 
“He’s a quick learner; you give him a bit of information and he takes it on board." More on this story:
